meanings.definition: To improvise or make do with whatever is at hand.
meanings.sent1: When I couldn't find my toolbox, I started kludging with a butter knife.
meanings.sent2: She was kludging a Halloween costume out of old clothes and cardboard.
meanings.sent3: The chef was kludging a new recipe using only leftovers from the fridge.
meanings.sent4: He was kludging together a plan to fix the leaky faucet with duct tape.
meanings.sent5: The students were kludging a last-minute project using paper clips and glue.

meanings.definition: A makeshift solution or temporary fix.
meanings.sent1: The tent they set up in the backyard was just a kludging for a camping trip.
meanings.sent2: His excuse for being late was a kludging about traffic.
meanings.sent3: The broken chair was a kludging with books stacked underneath.
meanings.sent4: The leak was only temporarily stopped with a kludging of towels and buckets.
meanings.sent5: The sign on the door was a kludging made from a torn piece of paper.

meanings.definition: The act of cobbling together or patching something together quickly and haphazardly.
meanings.sent1: The kludging of the old car engine got it running, but just barely.
meanings.sent2: The kludging of the broken vase made it look like new from afar.
meanings.sent3: His explanation was a kludging of half-truths and excuses.
meanings.sent4: The kludging of the torn dress with safety pins was a temporary fix.
meanings.sent5: The kludging of the computer system kept it working, but barely.
